revised_title: The Fungal Nature of Mycetoma and Its Varieties
tldr: The authors conducted a study on mycetoma, a chronic inflammatory disease, and identified two varieties of the disease based on the appearance of black and white particles. They concluded that the black particles are composed of a large, branching fungus, while the white particles consist of caseous material and a lowly organized fungus. The study provides insights into the nature and characteristics of the fungi involved in mycetoma.
